results.title: Abnormal barrier function in the pathogenesis of ichthyosis: therapeutic implications for lipid metabolic disorders.
results.text_hl: As a result, depending upon the identified pathomechanism(s) for each disorder, the accompanying @<m>DISEASE_Ichthyosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007057 @@@ichthyosis@@@ can be treated by topical provision of pathway product (eg, @CHEMICAL_Cholesterol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002784 @@@cholesterol@@@), with or without a proximal enzyme inhibitor (eg, @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@), to block metabolite production.

citations.NLM: Elias PM, Williams ML, Feingold KR. Abnormal barrier function in the pathogenesis of ichthyosis: therapeutic implications for lipid metabolic disorders. Clin Dermatol. 2012 May-Jun;30(3):311-22. PMID: 22507046
